1360713836400177157.text: Four of the states in 1787 had impeachment clauses in their state constitution that specifically allowed impeaching a former official, but when they wrote the United States Constitution, they only allowed current officials.

1360713835452235776.text: “when the President of the United States is tried, the Chief Justice shall preside.” (Article I, Sec 3, Clause 6)...“judgment in cases of impeachment shall not extend further than to removal from office, & disqualification to hold & enjoy any office.” (Article I, Sec 3, Clause 7)

1360713834546286593.text: The US Constitution outlines the basic process for impeachment and trial of the president, but it says nothing about trying a former president: “The president…shall be removed from office on impeachment…” (Article II, Section 4)

1360713833539592192.text: I cannot support removing someone from office who is no longer in office. An impeachment trial after someone has left office is unconstitutional.

On social distancing: 

"Take the social distancing seriously,"Bratzler said. "I think if we do it early, if we really get serious about social distancing now, we can reduce the length of this outbreak and get back to normal life down the road."

1240362987224993795.text:
On testing shortages: 

Lankford said he expects testing to be much more available in the coming week, and said Congress is trying to figure out how best to address what seems to be a looming financial crisis.

1240362986260357121.text: That's important because of the wide variation in reactions to the virus, Lankford and Bratzler said. While most of those infected develop only mild symptoms, some number will die.

1240362985262112768.text: "The third important point ... is that for every known person there are probably between five and 10 people who are infected but don't know they're infected."

1240362983852834817.text: "Second, it's very infectious. It spreads quite rapidly from person to person. A person infected by this virus may have symptoms before the first person even knows they're infected.

1240362982342905856.text: "No. 1, this is a novel virus," Bratzler said. "There is no immunity from this virus. If we're exposed to it, we will be infected.

1218609708124254208.text: It’s been a long road, but after 50 years #SocialSecurity disability will reflect a 21st century economy. Thanks @realDonaldTrump for pushing these much-needed changes over the finish line.

1218609706966667264.text: In 2015, I offered an amendment to the Budget Act that would improve the process & prevent those from receiving #SocialSecurity disability who aren't disabled. Part of that amendment again included updating the grid.

1218609705800687616.text: We have been fighting for updates for years. In 2014, I requested that the Acting Commissioner make 11 reforms to #SocialSecurity disability that they had agency authority to change and didn’t need congressional approval for. One of those was updating the grid.

1218609704320016385.text: The grid hasn’t been updated since 1978. Because of that, the eligibility criteria doesn’t include modern day jobs that use 21st century technologies.

1218609702847885319.text: Under the current system, part of #SocialSecurity disability eligibility is defined by an employment grid, which is a list of every job in the marketplace. It is used with a decision-making tool that factors things like age, education, & work experience.

1218609701279150080.text: Big news for the future of @SocialSecurity disability program. The eligibility criteria hasn't been meaningfully updated since 1978, leaving many on disability even though there are opportunities for those who want to work. https://t.co/pN2PUzG8iU

1174004237426155521.text: Next time you visit DC, be sure to visit my office to pick up a pocket-sized Constitution & then head over to the National Archives to see the actual document signed by our Founding Fathers. https://t.co/C4kSbkK9s8

1174004218040111104.text: Our freedom of religion, speech, press, peaceful assembly, and petition of our government are all protected in this 232-year-old document. These rights are the bedrock of our nation.

1174004216567881728.text: It also divides power between state and federal government. The Framers understood that most issues should be handled by state and local governments.

1174004214969851906.text: The Constitution provides the framework for the organization of our government – a separation of powers between three co-equal branches - (legislative) Congress, (judicial) Supreme Court, and (executive) the President.

1174004213489262593.text: #OnThisDay 232 years ago, the Constitution of the United States was signed, establishing & recognizing the basic rights of EVERY American citizen, which is why we commemorate #ConstitutionDay.
